column2: COLORADO DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Colorado
column6: CO

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column4: at any time.
column6: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn permitted on red light
column6: Drivers must turn right

column2: 3. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 4. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column4: check your rearview mirror.
column6: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 5. Regulation signs normally are:
column4: green rectangles.
column6: blue rectangles.

column2: 6. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column10: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.

column2: 7. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column4: have no driving errors.
column6: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 8. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
column4: check your rear view mirror.
column6: adjust the steering wheel.

column2: 9. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.
column6: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
column8: apply the brake and slow down.

column2: 10. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: are easier for the driver to operate.
column6: require more space for turning movements.
column8: take longer than cars to stop.
column10: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.

column2: 11. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column6: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 12. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your hands off the wheel
column6: take your attention away from driving
column8: take your eyes off the road

column2: 13. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column6: your own reaction time.
column10: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 14. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column4: orange
column6: yellow

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Right lane closed
column6: Winding road

column2: 16. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: gives you time to react to situations.
column6: prevents distractions from other vehicles.
column10: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.

column2: 17. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column4: decrease the following distance.
column6: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: T-intersection ahead
column6: Side road

column2: 19. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: within 250 feet of a traffic light.

column2: 20. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column8: The traffic light will soon be red.
column10: You must come to a complete stop.
